content: Yes, the distinct vestiges of totalitarianism. . . not only behavior but our very thoughts must be jackass-pure and leftist-true. Daring to openly discuss the intentions and behavior of the messiah, the one--no matter how well-supported by the facts of the deepest influences of his life and the cult that falsifies the deep threat of his ideas and action for an American nation true to the Constitution and worthy of the patriots who created it--is verboten. So decrees the sicherheitsdienst of the obamanation.

content: ---http://wnd.com/index.php?fa=PAGE.view&pageId=94373 'GIVE' creating youth brigades? Service corps expansion gives opponents shivers quote: Joseph Farah, founder and editor of WND, used his daily column first to raise the issue of a "national civilian force" and then to elevate it with a call to all reporters to start asking questions. "If we're going to create some kind of national police force as big, powerful and well-funded as our combined U.S. military forces, isn't this rather a big deal?" Farah wrote. "I thought Democrats generally believed the U.S. spent too much on the military. How is it possible their candidate is seeking to create some kind of massive but secret national police force that will be even bigger than the Army, Navy, Marines and Air Force put together? "Is Obama serious about creating some kind of domestic security force bigger and more expensive than that? If not, why did he say it? What did he mean?" Farah wrote.
quote: Joseph Farah, founder and editor of WND, used his daily column first to raise the issue of a "national civilian force" and then to elevate it with a call to all reporters to start asking questions. "If we're going to create some kind of national police force as big, powerful and well-funded as our combined U.S. military forces, isn't this rather a big deal?" Farah wrote. "I thought Democrats generally believed the U.S. spent too much on the military. How is it possible their candidate is seeking to create some kind of massive but secret national police force that will be even bigger than the Army, Navy, Marines and Air Force put together? "Is Obama serious about creating some kind of domestic security force bigger and more expensive than that? If not, why did he say it? What did he mean?" Farah wrote.
reply: ---http://wnd.com/index.php?fa=PAGE.view&pageId=94373 'GIVE' creating youth brigades? Service corps expansion gives opponents shivers
title: Who is this guy?

content: GWB was and is a neocon, not a "true" Republican. I was a Republican most of my life and worked for the US Congress as a Republican. George Bush was not a traditional Republican, he and Karl Rove created the "neo-con" tag by being who they were. And, now the Republican Party has to begin to dig out of the neo-con bunker and create a new foundation based on "party tradition". If you want to find out more about the GOP try looking up the Ripon Society who has mostly Republicans on its board, like US Senator Olympia Snow. Even President Eisenhower thought the Bush's (at that time) were "crazy" and said so as they tried to get him to change some of his policies. He would not meet with them. As for the Obama Volunteers brought up volunteerism like Vista, Peace Corps, Score/Ace, Older Americans Programs (Foster Grandparent Program,), Job Corps, have been great for many American citizens. If they are all programmed into American Traditional Volunteer roles they will be fine. During WWII my aunt was our local block Civil Defense Warden...the family still has her picture with her whit helmet on and the CD logo on the front...that was real Americanism.
reply: GWB was and is a neocon, not a "true" Republican. I was a Republican most of my life and worked for the US Congress as a Republican. George Bush was not a traditional Republican, he and Karl Rove created the "neo-con" tag by being who they were. And, now the Republican Party has to begin to dig out of the neo-con bunker and create a new foundation based on "party tradition". If you want to find out more about the GOP try looking up the Ripon Society who has mostly Republicans on its board, like US Senator Olympia Snow. Even President Eisenhower thought the Bush's (at that time) were "crazy" and said so as they tried to get him to change some of his policies. He would not meet with them. As for the Obama Volunteers brought up volunteerism like Vista, Peace Corps, Score/Ace, Older Americans Programs (Foster Grandparent Program,), Job Corps, have been great for many American citizens. If they are all programmed into American Traditional Volunteer roles they will be fine. During WWII my aunt was our local block Civil Defense Warden...the family still has her picture with her whit helmet on and the CD logo on the front...that was real Americanism.
title: Who is this guy?

content: quote: Originally posted by transport1: quote: Originally posted by ProgMod: quote: Originally posted by RRR52: Yes, the distinct vestiges of totalitarianism. . . not only behavior but our very thoughts must be jackass-pure and leftist-true. Daring to openly discuss the intentions and behavior of the messiah, the one--no matter how well-supported by the facts of the deepest influences of his life and the cult that falsifies the deep threat of his ideas and action for an American nation true to the Constitution and worthy of the patriots who created it--is verboten. So decrees the sicherheitsdienst of the obamanation. How very Nationalsozialistische Sicherheitsdienst des RfSS of you...... and this represents the other of the high intellect the left can offer, not complete analysis, but a trite attempt at mockery. Now imagine a picture of PBHO in a T-shirt advocating slavery, and you will be on the same sheet of music. Lets back up for a moment to see who really instigated this "high intellect" and incomplete analysis as you call it. "Yes, the distinct vestiges of totalitarianism. . . not only behavior but our very thoughts must be jackass-pure and leftist-true. Daring to openly discuss the intentions and behavior of the messiah, the one--no matter how well-supported by the facts of the deepest influences of his life and the cult that falsifies the deep threat of his ideas and action for an American nation true to the Constitution and worthy of the patriots who created it--is verboten. So decrees the sicherheitsdienst of the obamanation." That's correct, it was RRR52 that is calling the Obama administration, "the distinct vestiges of totalitarianism." I didn't write that, I criticised it sarcastically because it bears no merit! He is further insulting the Obama administration, by saying it's not permissable to even discuss the administration's intentions. And, going so far to say it's criminal and un-constitutional to speak against it, is pure horse manure! Furthermore, he is comparing the administration to the "Sicherheitsdienst." The was a Nazi Party organization, and translated literally means "the nazi party security police from 1933-45, and branch of the SS." It was made up of the Gestapo and the (Kripo)-Criminal Police. This branch was directly under the command of Reinhard Heydrich, who was directly under the overall head of the "SS" Henrich Himmler. Now, I was being sarcastic about it, because a sarcastic comment rightly deserves one in return. That's why my response - translated; "How very Nazi Party-SS Security Police on the staff of the Reichs Leader SS (Himmler) of you," was appropriate. A horses azz comment, rightly deserves one in return! Duh! Bush wearing his neocon t-shirt, simply reiterated my point. This message has been edited. Last edited by: ProgMod, Tue 14 April 2009 05:01 PM No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz
